p:
The RVFV genome is organized in three negative-sense, single-stranded RNA segments termed large (L), medium (M), and small (S), with a total genome length of 11.9 kb. The large segment (∼6.4 kb) encodes the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase [ 23]; the M segment (∼3.2 kb) encodes envelope glycoproteins G
n and G
c , plus two accessory proteins, NSm and the 78-kDa protein [ 24]. The S ambisense segment (∼1.7 kb) encodes for nucleoprotein (NP; 27 kDa) and non-structural protein (NSs; 31-kDa). Previous studies have sequenced the three virus segments from diverse strains circulating in outbreaks across Africa and Saudi Arabia [ 25].
